All facility-based and home/community-based activities for HIV-infected adults and their families aimed at extending and optimizing quality of life for HIV-infected clients and their families throughout the continuum of illness through provision of clinical, psychological, spiritual, social and prevention services. ZAMFAM (TBD OVC project) is a follow-on to STEPS OVC, and will be open to local (indigenous) Zambian organizations interested in implementing a three- to five-year program in Comprehensive Integrated Service Delivery and Support for Families Caring for Orphans and Vulnerable Children (OVC) and People Living with HIV/AIDS (PLWHA). The project will also have a ZAMFAM Capacity Building Project which will assist the local organizations in organizational development and other duties as identified during the organization’s assessment process. The purpose of the project is to improve outcomes through support to implement comprehensive and coordinated evidence-based interventions that strengthen the capacity of families and communities to care for their vulnerable children throughout Zambia. This project will contribute to the improved care and support for people living/affected by HIV/AIDS, and strengthen the organizational and technical capacity of local organizations to mitigate the HIV/AIDS impact. This activity will contribute to the achievement of the USAID/Zambia Mission Country Development Cooperative Strategy’s (CDCS), Development Objective 2, Rural Poverty Reduced in Targeted Areas and Development Objective 3, Human Capital Improved, by reducing the impact of HIV/AIDS on vulnerable households through a multi-sector response. USAID intends to issue multiple awards (3-5), providing and an estimated period of each award made under this program is between three to five years; activities covering no less than three years and no more than five years. Each award is estimated to be between $3 million and $25 million in total funding for the life of the award. The following provinces have been prioritized: Central, Copperbelt, Luapula, Lusaka, and Southern Provinces.
